DataElement.preferredName: Record Identification National Provider Identifier Registry Identifier Transmission Source Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The NPI (National Provider Identifier) code that represents the data transmission source. This item stores the NPI of the facility registry that transmits the record.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Record Identification National Provider Identifier Registry Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The National Provider Identifier for the data transmission source facility registry that transmits the record.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:An official written record of names or events or transactions.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
An official written record of names or events or transactions.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: National Provider Identifier Transmission Source Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The NPI (National Provider Identifier) code that represents the data transmission source. This item stores the NPI of the facility registry that transmits the record.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: National Provider Identifier Transmission Source Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.:Source; where something is available.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NPI Registry ID Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: NPI, a unique identification number for health care providers, is scheduled for 2007-2008 implementation by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) as part of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA). For billing purposes large practices and large group providers will be required to use NPI codes by May 2007; small health plans will be required to use NPI codes by May 2008. When a facility starts to use the NPI codes, that information should be transmitted in the appropriate NPI data items.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NPI Registry ID Code Source
ReferenceDocuments.description: Codes [only valid NPI assigned 10-digit numeric codes (9-digit number plus 1 check digit). The check digit algorithm is available at: https://nppes.cms.hhs.gov/NPPES/NPIRegistryHome.do]
